Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a large red pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse, interior slightly grooved, exterior covered with a cream/light-brown coloured slip and with remains of at least eight lines of black-painted demotic text, now faded and smudged in places.
Curator's comments: Being studied for publication by Bryan Kraemer. Thot 'Great of 5' Group
Bibliographic references: Peet 1914 / Cemeteries of Abydos II. 1911-1912 (124-125, pl.25.6)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393115) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393115)
Almásy-Martin 2020 / Demotic, Greek and Coptic ostraca from Abydos in the British Museum (no.6)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.BM Abydos Dem. 6 (Edition abbreviation according to Oates et al. 2001)
